text: Raymond Henry Schmandt (January 25, 1896 – February 2, 1969) born in St. Louis, Missouri, was a first baseman for the St. Louis Browns (1915) and Brooklyn Robins (1918–22). He helped the Robins win the 1920 National League Pennant. In 6 seasons he played in 317 Games and had 1,054 At Bats, 122 Runs, 284 Hits, 36 Doubles, 13 Triples, 3 Home Runs, 122 RBI, 11 Stolen Bases, 46 Walks, .269 Batting Average, .301 On-base percentage, .337 Slugging Percentage, 355 Total Bases and 31 Sacrifice Hits. He died in St. Louis at the age of 73. ==Sources== * Category:1896 births Category:1969 deaths Category:Major League Baseball first basemen Category:Baseball players from Missouri Category:St. Louis Browns players Category:Brooklyn Robins players Category:Sportspeople from St. Louis Category:Minor league baseball managers Category:Bloomington Bloomers players Category:Lincoln Links players Category:Houston Buffaloes players Category:Indianapolis Indians players Category:Memphis Chickasaws players Category:Savannah Indians players Category:Canton Terriers players Category:Quincy Indians players
title: Ray Schmandt
